metadata.chief_complaint: 1 year well check, CBC, lead, 4 vaccines, extensive anticipatory guidance

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Happy birthday to Oliver! One year already!

script.speaker: parent
script.text: I know, it went so fast. He's a totally different person than a year ago.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Let's see what he's up to. Is he walking yet?

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Cruising along furniture, taking a few steps between things, but not walking independently yet.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: That's perfect for twelve months. Any words?

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Dada, mama, ball, dog. Maybe five or six words.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Excellent. Does he follow simple instructions like 'give me the ball' or 'wave bye-bye'?

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Yeah, he understands a lot. He points at things he wants.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Great. How's eating going? Still on formula or have you switched to milk?

script.speaker: parent
script.text: We just switched to whole milk this week. He's taking it fine. Eating table food pretty well too.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Perfect timing on the milk switch. Is he using a cup at all?

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Sippy cup mostly. We're trying an open cup but it's messy.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: That's normal. Keep practicing with the open cup. By eighteen months we want to be off bottles completely.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Got it. No bottles by eighteen months.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Let me examine him.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: He's twenty-two pounds and thirty inches. That's 60th percentile for weight and 55th for height. Head circumference is 75th percentile, same as before. All consistent.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Ears are clear, heart and lungs normal. Teeth look good, I see eight teeth. Belly is soft. Walking along the table nicely.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: He looks wonderful. Now, one year visits are big ones. We have several things to do today.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Lay it on me.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: First, labs. We need to check his hemoglobin, that's a blood count to screen for anemia. And we check lead level at one year. It's a finger poke.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Both from the finger poke?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Yes, one poke gets us both tests.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Okay. What about vaccines?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: He needs four vaccines today. MMR, which is measles, mumps, rubella. Varicella, that's chickenpox. Hepatitis A, first dose. And Prevnar, which is pneumococcal.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Four vaccines. He's going to be mad at me.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: He'll forgive you. We'll do two in each leg. It's quick.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Any side effects I should watch for?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Fussiness and low-grade fever are common. The MMR and varicella can sometimes cause a mild rash or fever about a week later. That's actually a sign the vaccine is working.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Good to know. What else?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Let me go through some safety and development guidance. At this age, drowning is a big risk. Never leave him alone near water, even an inch of it.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: We have a pool at my parents' house. We're careful.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Good. Always within arm's reach in water. Also, car seat should be rear-facing until age two, or until he maxes out the height and weight limits.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: He's still rear-facing.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Perfect. Outlet covers, cabinet locks, gates on stairs?

script.speaker: parent
script.text: All done. House is baby-proofed.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Great. Screen time, try to avoid it before age two if possible. Reading and interactive play are much better for brain development.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: We read to him every night.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Love to hear it. Last thing, start brushing his teeth twice a day with a tiny smear of fluoride toothpaste, rice grain size.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: We've been using the training toothpaste without fluoride.

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: Time to switch to fluoride now that he has teeth. It prevents cavities.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Got it. So, to recap: finger poke for anemia and lead, four vaccines, rear-facing until two, fluoride toothpaste. Anything else?

script.speaker: doctor
script.text: That covers it. Next visit is fifteen months. Call if any concerns before then.

script.speaker: parent
script.text: Thanks, Doc. Here we go, buddy.
